uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend

Class FacebookDataCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend.SecondaryDataCollector
      • uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend.FacebookDataCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, DataCollector

    public class FacebookDataCollector
extends SecondaryDataCollector
    Secondary data collector which gets data from Facebook's public API.
    Author:
    Johann Beleites

      • setup

        public void setup(java.util.List<Individual> individuals)
        Description copied from class: SecondaryDataCollector
        This method is used to setup the collector before it is run in its own thread. Primary data collectors do not need to implement this and should return immediately.
        Specified by:
        setup in class SecondaryDataCollector
        Parameters:
        individuals - The list of individuals, containing only basic information, whose data should be looked up.

      • getAttributeTable

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,AttributeCategories> getAttributeTable()
        Description copied from class: SecondaryDataCollector
        This method returns a table of the attributes that this collector supports. The table is a set of key-value pairs, with each key being a string equal to the name of the attribute, and each value being an AttributeCategory. The returned Hashtable object may for example contain the following key-value pairs:
        Attribute Name Global Attribute Type
        twitter.username GlobalAttributeType.USER_NAME
        twitter.displaypic GlobalAttributeType.PHOTO
        ... ...
        The data collection manager will build the global attribute table by combining the attribute tables returned by each collector.
        Overrides:
        getAttributeTable in class SecondaryDataCollector
        Returns:
        A Hashtable containing all the attributes supported with their global types.

      • reauthenticate

        public void reauthenticate()
                    throws AuthorizationFailedException
        Will prompt the user to enter a user token at this stage. This token will be used to authenticate all request to facebook. It WILL also accept invalid / stale tokens without throwing an exception; those will only be caught later. AuthorizationFailedException will only be thrown when the input is less than 1 character long (or null) at this point. Note: The easiest way to obtain a token (valid for a couple of hours) from Facebook is to go to https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer and copy and paste the string from the 'access token' field into the input prompt displayed by this method.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationFailedException
